cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north, forecast to turn northwest toward the South Carolina coast this weekend, then curve northeast and track up the U.S. East Coast, passing near the Mid-Atlantic before moving offshore south of New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast (between Charleston and Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from Georgia northward through the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England, including the New Jersey and Delaware coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions Monday–Tuesday with sustained winds generally 20–30 mph and a low (≤7 %) chance of reaching tropical-storm force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware River terminals; only minor coastal inundation possible along the open New Jersey shore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible as the remnant circulation passes, with pockets of heavier showers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore; minor coastal flooding at high tide.
